usefulItems: heatproof glass jars (Ø 6 cm, height 8 cm), heat-resistant cling film, refrigerator
title: Red Berry Cheesecakes in Jars

ingredients.content: 20 g whole mixed nuts (e.g. hazelnuts, walnuts, pistachios, almonds)
200 g mixed fresh red berries or frozen

preparations.content: Place butter, biscuits, nuts and brown sugar in mixing bowl and crush <b>10 sec/speed 7<b>. Divide crumb mixture between 6 heatproof glass jars (Ø 6 cm, height 8 cm). Use a spoon or fingers to press crumb mixture down.

Place cream cheese, cream, sugar, vanilla sugar, salt and eggs in mixing bowl and mix <b>1 min/speed 4<b>. Pour cheesecake filling over crumb base in glass jars. Cover jars with heat-resistant cling film or lids and place in Varoma dish. Clean mixing bowl.
Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma in position and steam <b>22 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Remove Varoma and set aside uncovered to cool a little. Discard water and continue with making the topping.

Place red berries and sugar in mixing bowl and cook <b>11 min/100°C/speed 1<b>. Top each cheesecake with 2 Tbsp berry jam. Allow cheesecakes to cool completely, then refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving chilled.

hintsAndTricks: These individual cheesecakes may seem ideal for portion control, but willpower is necessary to eat only one! They can be made ahead, brought to a picnic, offered as a gift, frozen for later, adapted to individual tastes…a great recipe to have up your sleeve.

Once thoroughly chilled, cheesecakes may be frozen for serving later.
- Instead of jars use small heatproof drinking glasses or coffee cups.

Add flavourings to the filling (e.g. zest from one lemon or lime, ½ tsp ground cinnamon).
- For a nut-free version, omit nuts and use 60 g biscuits.
- For a lighter version, omit crumb base.
- Instead of cooked berries, top with fresh seasonal fruit, caramel sauce or chocolate ganache.
